reviewText:
50 Action Classics 4 DVD

This is a four DVD set with mostly old B&W movies. There are 26 movies and two 12-episode serials for "50 movies". You will find most of them entertaining and educational. An asterisk denotes one chapter of a 12-part serail. The 1920 movie is silent, but still interesting. The "Disaster at Sea" serial was also called "SOS Coast Guard". These entertained people in the years before television. "Bloody Friday" is a European crime drama that has language and actions that would not pass Hollywood censorship. Here are the contents of the four DVDs.

Mr. Robinson Crusoe - D. Fairbanks 1932
The Capture - Lew Ayres 1950
Captain Scarface - Barton Mac Lane 1953
